remarks: If two structures have the same components (properties), one is a left vector space iff the other one is.  This version of ~ lvecpropd also breaks up the components of the scalar ring.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 27-Jun-2015.)
statement:
lvecprop2d.b1 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` K ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.b2 $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` L ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.f $e |- F = ( Scalar ` K ) $.
lvecprop2d.g $e |- G = ( Scalar ` L ) $.
lvecprop2d.p1 $e |- ( ph -> P = ( Base ` F ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.p2 $e |- ( ph -> P = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.1 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. B /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` K ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` L ) y ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.2 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. P ) ) -> ( x ( +g ` F ) y ) = ( x ( +g ` G ) y ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.3 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. P ) ) -> ( x ( .r ` F ) y ) = ( x ( .r ` G ) y ) ) $.
lvecprop2d.4 $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. P /\ y e. B ) ) -> ( x ( .s ` K ) y ) = ( x ( .s ` L ) y ) ) $.
lvecprop2d $p |- ( ph -> ( K e. LVec <-> L e. LVec ) ) $.
$d B x y $.
$d F x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d K x y $.
$d L x y $.
$d P x y $.
$d ph x y $.
